pageTitle: Walt Disney World Resort Update (Walt Disney World Resort Update) by Marie Rossiter
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {30217=8:00 a.m. – 7:30 p.m., 23673=The contest, which began June 4 and ends July 22, asks entrants to show off their "Seven Dwarfs-inspired skills" with pictures or smartphone video. Each week, the official Be the 8th Miner website publishes a new challenge for entrants to use as inspiration for their pictures and/or videos. Once entrants submit their photo or video, they need to follow @WaltDisneyWorld on Twitter and tweet their entry with the hashtag #8thMinerContest., 11245=On August 23, Disney's Hollywood Studios visitors can get up close to nearly 50 classic Disney villains during a new nighttime, hard-ticket event "Villains Unleashed," which runs from 8 p.m. to 1 a.m., 66889=2014 Free Dining Offer for Disney Rewards VISA & Debit Card Holders, 13278=Marketplace Co-Op officially opened last weekend in the Downtown Disney Marketplace. Visitors had the chance to get a first glimpse of the variety of merchandise offered at Downtown Disney's newest retail location during a grand opening event on June 6., 77004=2014 Free Dining offers for U.K. residents have been released. From the information posted on the Virgin Holidays website, it appears the 2014 program offers free Quick Service Dining Plan plan when booking at a Moderate resort, and free Dining Plan when booking at Deluxe resorts, Old Key West or Saratoga Springs. There are also offers for a free $200 Disney Gift Card and/or a 14-day ticket for the price of a 7-day ticket depending on travel dates. These particular offers are valid for U.K. residents only., 76937=2014 Free Dining offer for U.K. residents, 33317=7:00 p.m., 20860=The construction work means crews must redirect traffic to alleviate congestion. Jeff Kober., 49223=2014, 59857=2014 Free Dining offer for general public, 17977=On June 15 and 16, car enthusiasts have a chance to enjoy a classic car show at the Car Masters Weekend hosted by Downtown Disney's West Side., 57032=As reported in July, some refrigerators in non-Disney Vacation Club rooms at Walt Disney World are being replaced due to a product defect. All Walt Disney World Resort rooms with the exception of DVC Villas, the family suites at the Art of Animation and All-Star Movie resorts, and the cabins at Fort Wilderness are impacted. Disney says "the schedule for replacing the refrigerators at these Resorts is expected to last several months.", 42247=June is full of hot, humid weather and thunderstorms, so be prepared. textBeforeTable: Events and times may change. Consult daily times guides and tip board for daily updates. Celebrity Lineup: Dee Bradley Baker (Captain Rex/the Clones, Bossk – The Clone Wars); Cat Taber (Padme Amidala – The Clone Wars); Tom Kane (Yoda – The Clone Wars); Matt Lanter (Anakin Skywalker – The Clone Wars); Steve Blum (Zeb Orrelios – Star Wars Rebels) Tour information: Star Wars Weekends wraps up this weekend and includes more stars and stories to excite Star Wars fans of all ages. As always, arrive early to events for the best possible chance to see your favorites and schedule Fastpass+ reservations to secure your place. This week at Disney's Hollywood Studios Star Wars Weekends The interior of Disney's Animal Kingdom Festival of the Lion King theater almost perfectly matches its previous location and the show remains the same. Photo by J. Jeff Kober. Disney's Animal Kingdom's Festival of the Lion King queue has options for Fastpass+ and standby lines. Photo by J. Jeff Kober.
textAfterTable: Quick takes ...Epcot's Africa Refreshment Cool Post in World Showcase has new menu items meant to beat the heat or quench the adult thirst. Visitors can order the new coconut or pineapple frozen yogurt (or get them both swirled together) served in a dish for $3.99. Grownups looking for a more "adult" treat can pick up an African Rum Mango Smoothie for $9.50. ...Epcot's Sounds Like Summer concert series debuts this week on June 8 at the American Gardens Theatre featuring Hotel California – A Salute to the Eagles. Click here for our report on the full Sounds Like Summer lineup. ...Downtown Disney's new Starbucks location has something extra special for its customers: a "magic chalkboard" that can automatically draw whatever stands in front of it. According to BusinessWeek.com, customers can also draw on the 70-inch touchscreen to create their own pictures or play games like hangman or tic-tac-toe. The digital chalkboard connects to the Downtown Disney Starbucks location in Anaheim, CA so visitors can share what's going on in each store. A touch screen at Walt Disney's World's Downtown Disney Starbucks allows users to interact with the Starbucks at Downtown Disney in Anaheim. Photo by
